messages.title: CAN YOU WIN? YES!
messages.content: Plymouth Sutton and Devonport voted LEAVE by 54.41% to 45.59%. Plymouth also voted by 59.59% to 40.41% to have a mayoral role. MP's try to convince us they are Remainers who respect the referendum vote, but YOU can't say you respect the result and then block Brexit legislation.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We do not make wild promises about abolishing student tuition loans but will review the system and rethink interest rates.
We will remove business rates from such places and lobby for a small online sales tax.
A clean break Brexit will return control over our own waters to the UK.
Will be in strategic national industries (Nissan, BAE, Tata, etc.) to promote growth and create skilled jobs in UK.
We will plant millions of trees and stop non-recyclable plastics.
We need more police but crucially we need to target gang crime, burglaries, etc. and de-escalate police from targeted offenders.
Once we have left the EU we will zero rate our own VAT rates.

community.content: We will remove business rates from such places and lobby for a small online sales tax.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have close family connections with the city where I was born in St. Budeaux and grew up in Plymouth. My father came here from the Tamsin in Salads and worked in High School and my mother at the Plymouth Railway station... That was what drew me to Plymouth Sutton and Devonport to win the seat of the Labour held seat for the first time since 1833 when David Owen was MP.

examples: Plymouth Sutton and Devonport voted LEAVE by 54.41% to 45.59%.

We will remove business rates from such places and lobby for a small online sales tax.
We need more police but crucially we need to target gang crime, burglaries, etc. and de-escalate police from targeted offenders.
